subject: Re: [junit] Testing multi threaded application

messageBody:
Decide what you want to test. Are you worried about a thread not starting or
an object not getting its fair share of processing time? Or are you worried
about the object doing what it's supposed to do when it gets processing
time? I suspect the latter. If so, decouple threading policies from the
object and ignore threads while testing. System tests will test the
threading issues.



On 7/25/03 1:37 PM, "pnjack2001" <pnjack2001@...> wrote:

> Hi all,
> I read a few posts about how to test mutli threaded applications,
> however my case is a bit different.
> I have an application that when started does some work, and then
> spins off several threads that do some more work on the same object,
> while the main thread returns to a wait state or process the next
> incoming request.
> eg. Main application receives some data, process it, and then creates
> an object1, creates another thread to work on that object1, and goes
> back to process the next incoming message.
> Does anyone know how can I unit test this?
>
> Any ideas greatly appreciated
>
